comment.description: What is meant by title? Do you mean: "ISO/CD-TS 10303-1070 Product data representation and exchange: Application module: Class"? The use of the words "application module" has been used extensively throughout the documentation of the modules.

This means that only the name of the module itself ("Class") should be within the <a> element, not the phrase "Class application module". I'm not suggesting that you remove the words "application module," just move them outside the <a> element.

There is a requirement to specify which type of identification another identification system provides an alias for. Currently Alias_identification only points at the thing that is given an alias id, but does not relate to the other ids. Either Alias_identification should get an optional link to an Identification_assignment, or Alias_identification.items can be assigned directly to an Identification_assignment.

comment.description: The concept of an alial is that it is an alternate name for the same thing. If mulitple identifiers are assigned to an entity, then these are, by definition, aliases. This issue is therefore closed withot further action. However, it is recommended that the requirement be reviewed to see if an "identifier_relationship" with role is required as a separate module.

I think that this is a valid issue.
The alias_identification is used from the PDM modules where the alias was the alias for the id attribute in product. Within PLCS we have used identification_assignment rather than id attributes to provide identifiers. Consequently, there is no way to indicate what identifier an alias is for.
As the alias_identification module is at ISO-TS stage, I suggest that we should go for the 2nd option and extend the ap239_mri_alias_identification_item select with identification_assignment.
Will need to extend ap239_mri_aliasable_item in the MIM as well.
